week2_questions.question: What is the complement of a set A in the universal set U?
options: All elements in U that are not in A
All elements in both A and U

week2_questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a power set?
If A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}, what is A − B?
How many subsets does a set with 3 elements have?
What is the union of sets A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3, 4}?
Which of the following is a characteristic of a set?
If A ⊂ B and A = {1, 2}, which of the following could be B?
If the universal set U = {1, 2, 3, 4} and A = {1, 2}, what is the complement of A?
What is the relationship between two sets if A ∩ B = ∅?
options: A is a subset of B
A is a superset of B

week2_questions.question: Which of the following describes a finite set?
options: A set with a limited number of elements
A set with an infinite number of elements

week2_questions.question: Which operation on two sets gives the set of all elements that are in either set?
Which of the following best defines the symmetric difference of two sets A and B?
options: Elements in either A or B but not both
Elements in both A and B

week2_questions.question: If A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {3, 4, 5}, what is the symmetric difference A △ B?
Which property holds for the union operation?
What is the cardinality of a set?
options: The number of elements in the set
The order of elements in the set
The size of the universal set

week2_questions.question: If A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}, what is the cardinality of A ∩ B?
Which of the following operations is performed when finding the complement of a set?
options: All elements in the universal set that are not in the original set
All elements in the original set
All elements common to the original set and universal set

week2_questions.question: If A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {4, 5}, what is A ∪ B?
What is the power set of the empty set ∅?
